body.text: - Social media is an accessible platform, making it an easy option. - It can allow you to get things off your chest. - It might potentially protect your community.

- You could be sued for defamation - which could cost you a lot of money and time to defend. Suing survivors for defamation is a tool offenders use to get the survivor to recant what they have said. - You could ruin your own reputation if you are not believed. - You could face consequences at school, leading to a disruption in your education. - Social media posts last forever - you do not have control over who views them - even if you restrict your settings or later delete the post. Future bosses, partners, friends, teachers, may all have access to your post.
